intro: Piptatherum tibeticum, commonly known as Tibetan needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers, which are adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ecological significance and unique adaptations, it plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
